EPTools.utils.NSBH_ejecta_mass(M_BH, M_NS, Chi, R_NS)[source]
EPTools.utils.TA_quick(obsid, snum, root='', binsize=10, pha_file=None, rebin=2, grp=False, nH=None, group=None, rx=None, sep=True, ins='WXT', plotstyle='step', N=500, get_unabs=True, chatter=10, module='B')[source]

Perform quick analysis for TA.

Args: - obsid : str : e.g. ep06800000356wxt45 - snum : int : Source number - root (str, optional): Root directory of Grace data. Defaults to ‘./’. - binsize (int, optional): Size of bin in seconds. Defaults to 10. - rebin (int, optional): Rebin factor. Defaults to 2. - rx (float, optional): refine x range. - ins (str, optional): Instrument name. Defaults to ‘WXT’. - snum_prefix: specify snum in file searching

EPTools.utils.Txx(times, rates, c=0.9)[source]

c[float]: confident level [0,1], default=0.9 represent 90% credible level

EPTools.utils.X2mAB(F_X, nu_min, nu_max)[source]

Convert observed X-ray flux to AB magnitude.

Parameters: - F_X : float : Observed X-ray flux in erg/s/cm² (integrated over the band) - E_min : float : Minimum energy of the X-ray band in keV - E_max : float : Maximum energy of the X-ray band in keV

Returns: - m_AB : float : AB magnitude corresponding to the observed X-ray flux

EPTools.fit.dynesty_fitting(prior_transform, log_likeli, bounds, nlive, log_args)[source]
EPTools.fit.grp_data(src, bkg, outputname='PC.pi', arf=None, rmf=None, group=1)[source]
EPTools.fit.xspec_fitting(sname, mname: str, grp=False, arf=None, rmf=None, rebin=None, stat='cstat', instrument='WXT', untied=None, plotmode='data resid', chdir=None, N=500, chatter=10, **fixed_par)[source]

!!!Single Spectrum Fitting or Simutaneously Fitting!!! !!!To fit single Spectrum, same should be a str; for simutaneously fitting, sname should be a list of sname :param sname[str/list]: spectrum file :param mname: model name :type mname: str :param grp: whether the file are grouped :type grp: bool, optional :param arf: anxilury file :type arf: str/list, optional :param rmf: reponse file :type rmf: str/list, optional :param rebin: rebin :type rebin: float, optional :param instrument: ‘WXT’ or ‘FXT’ :type instrument: str or list, optional :param plotmode: xspec plot mode (e.g. data, ldata, edata) :type plotmode: str, optional :param untied: untied parameters. e.g. [‘powerlaw.norm=1,0.1’,…] :type untied: dict :param chdir: change home dir :type chdir: str :param fixed_par: fixed parameters. Second and third, forth model parameters are the same with the first one by default

Returns:

(energies,edeltas,rates,errors,model,labels)

Return type:

tuple or list of tuple

EPTools.plot.lcurve_plot(src, bkg, save_dir=None, binsize=10, scale=0.08333333333333333, rx=None, sep=False, show=False)[source]
EPTools.plot.plot_gcn_data(file_dir='', output='standard_gcn.pdf', ttype=0)[source]

Plot GCN Circilar data and EP-WXT/FXT data from .csv file ttype[int]: 0 for days; 1 for seconds in logsapce

Data Format:

data.csv: [dt, terr, instrument, mag, magerr, flux, fluxerr, detection, type] #flux in radio data often refers to flux density [mJy/uJy] #type should be either optical, x-ray or radio
